intro: Libanotis gracilis, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves contribute to its graceful appearance. Libanotis gracilis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
